abstract: United States Fish and Wildlife service places central and West African lions on endangered species list, after controversy over American hunter's killing of lion named Cecil in Zimbabwe; move is bid to reverse sharp recent decline of lion populations, and will forbid importing of lion parts as trophies from hunts.
lead_paragraph: Five months after the death of Cecil the lion spurred outrage, the new rules will make it more difficult for hunters to bring lion trophies into the United States.

headline.main: After Cecil Furor, U.S. Aims to Protect Lions Through Endangered Species Act
headline.print_headline: After Cecil Furor, U.S. Aims to Protect Lions Through Its Species Act

snippet: Five months after the death of Cecil the lion spurred outrage, the new rules will make it more difficult for hunters to bring lion trophies into the United States.
